node.title: Shell says exiting Russia has already cost it $5 billion
node.description: Energy giant's profits are taking a hit after it withdrew from joint ventures with Russia's Gazprom.
node.content: ["Shell says its decision to pull out of Russia in response to the country's invasion of\u00a0Ukraine\u00a0has already cost the international energy giant as much as $5 billion.", "The reduced value of Russian assets, credit losses and \"onerous\" contract terms will cut earnings for the first three months of the year by between $4 billion and $5 billion, London-based Shell said Thursday. The estimate was part of an update released before publication of complete first-quarter earnings on May 5.", "In 2021, Shell reported earnings of nearly $19.3 billion.\u00a0", "Shell said last month that it was \"appalled\" by the invasion of Ukraine as it announced plans to exit joint ventures with Russian state-owned energy company Gazprom. Those assets alone were valued at about $3 billion at the end of last year, according to Shell's annual report.", "The company later said it would\u00a0stop buying Russian oil\u00a0and withdraw from any involvement with Russian hydrocarbons \"regardless of their financial implications.\"", "Shell's decision came as the U.K. joined governments around the world in\u00a0imposing sanctions\u00a0on Russian companies, banks and wealthy individuals in an effort to pressure President Vladimir Putin to withdraw his forces from Ukraine.", "Energy companies are under pressure to cut ties with Russia because\u00a0oil and natural gas exports\u00a0are crucial to financing the Kremlin and its military.", "Over 600 companies have shut their operations in Russia or taken other steps to scale back their business in the country, according to a running\u00a0tally\u00a0maintained by researchers at the Yale School of Management."]
